questions.question:
Consider the following C program:


#include < stdio.h >
int main(){
int a = 6;
int b = 0;
while(a < 10) {
a = a / 12 + 1;
a += b;}
printf("%d", a);
return 0;}
Which one of the following statements is CORRECT?

(GATE CSE 2024 SET-1)
options:
C.

The program gets stuck in an infinite loop
questions.correct_answer:
C.

The program gets stuck in an infinite loop

questions.question:
What is printed by the following ANSI C program?

#include < stdio.h >
int main(int argc, char *argv[]){ 
 char a = 'P';
 char b = 'x';
 char c = (a  &  b) + '*';
 char d = (a | b) - '-';
 char e = (a ^ b) + '+'; 
 printf("%c %c %c \n", c, d, e); 
 return 0;
}

ASCII encoding for relevant characters is given below



(GATE CSE 2022)

questions.question:
Consider the following C program:


#include < stdio.h >
int main() {
 float sum = 0.0, j = 1.0, i = 2.0;
 while (i / j > 0.0625) {
    j = j + j; 
    sum = sum + i/j;
    printf("%f \n", sum);
 }
 return 0;
}
The number of times variable sum will be printed When the above program is executed is _________ .

(GATE CSE 2019)
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Consider the following C program:

 main()
{
float sum= 0.0, j=1.0,i=2.0;
while(i/j>0.001){
    j=j+1;
    sum=sum+i/j;
    printf("%f/n", sum);
  }
}


(ISRO CSE 2018)

questions.question:
Consider the following C code segment:

 #include < stdio.h >
main()
{
    int i, j, x;
    scanf("%d", &x);
    i=1; j=1;
    while (i<10) {
            j =j*i;
            i= i+1;
            if(i==x) break;
        }
}
For the program fragment above, which of the following statements about the variables i and j must be true after execution of this program? [ !(exclamation) sign denotes factorial in the answer]

(ISRO CSE 2018)
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
What does the following program do when the input is unsigned 16 bit integer?

 #include < stdio.h >
main(){
  unsigned int num;
  int i;
  scanf("%u", &num);
  for(i=0;i<16;i++){
    printf("%d", (num < < i&1 < < 15)?1:0);
  }
}


(ISRO CSE 2017)
options:
A.

It prints all even bits from num

B.

It prints all odd bits from num
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Consider the following C program.

 #include < stdio.h >
int main ( ) {
    int m = 10;
    int n, n1;
    n = ++m;
    n1 = m++;
    n--;
    --n1;
    n-=n1;
printf ("%d", n) ;
return 0;
}
The output of the program is ______________.

(GATE CSE 2017 SET-2)
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
How many lines of output does the following C code produce?

 #include < stdio.h >
float i=2.0;
float j=1.0;
float sum = 0.0;
main()
{
    while (i/j > 0.001)
    {
        j+=j;
        sum=sum+(i/j);
        printf("%f\n", sum);
    }
}


(ISRO CSE 2014)
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
What is the output of the following C program?

 #include < stdio.h >    
void main(void){
    int shifty;
    shifty=0570;
    shifty=shifty>>4;
    shifty=shifty<<6;
    printf("The value  of shifty is %o \n",shifty);  
}



(ISRO CSE 2014)
